titles.title: Providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 2183) to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to reform the financing of campaigns for elections for Federal office, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-567, by Mr. Linder.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2183. Provides for the further consideration of the bill in the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H.Res. 442. Specifies that all points of order against each amendment printed in the report of the committee on Rules (House Report 105-566) are waived if the amendment is offered by a Member designated in the report. An amendment so offered shall be considered as read.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 203.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 458, the rule providing for the further consideration of H.R. 2183, Bipartisan Campaign Integrity Act.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 221 - 194 (Roll No. 246).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 221 - 189 (Roll No. 247).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/4/1998--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (modified open) for the further consideration of H.R. 2183 (Federal election campaign financing)
